subject: Climate & Environment
title: Early Warning Systems Save Lives
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Early Warning Systems Save Lives.

hook.text: In 1970, a cyclone killed 500,000 people in Bangladesh. In 2020, a similar storm killed under 30.

buildup.text: The difference was early warning systems, evacuation shelters, and community preparedness.

discovery.text: Satellites, radar, and weather models now give days of advance notice before major storms.

twist.text: One-third of the world's population still lacks access to effective early warning systems.

climax.text: The UN is pushing for universal coverage by 2027 â€” the cheapest and most effective disaster investment.

punchline.text: We can't stop the storm. But a few hours' warning changes everything.

quiz.question: What reduced cyclone deaths in Bangladesh from 500,000 to under 30?
options: Early warning systems and evacuation shelters
Weaker storms due to climate change
